channel.title: Having trouble port forwarding [Windows 7]
channel.description: I'm in need of a little help when it comes to port forwarding on Windows 7. I have a Netopia 3347-02 7.8.1r2 router Possibly help me via Teamviewer? *edit Might i add that I have used the guide at Portforward.com When I use the port checker still tells me it isn't open Thanks.

item.title: Having trouble port forwarding [Windows 7]
item.dc:creator: @jkicool jkicool
item.description:
@jkicool wrote:

Check for a tutorial if your still having trouble but I hope I can help:
1.Get your modem password
2.Open cmd (command prompt)
3.Type in “ipconfig” (without parenthesis)
4.Copy your Default Gateway into your browser.
5.Type in your username and password
6.Open a port for “43594” or “55555” and make sure it a “Ftp” (File Transfer Protocol)(without parenthesis)
7.Set the rest of setting to “default”
8. Mount it on “your” computer

Tips: Make sure that your firewall are of because it can interfere with incoming and outgoing connections.

Read full topic

item.title: Having trouble port forwarding [Windows 7]
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Always remember to turn off your firewall.

Otherwise double check the settings and take a picture of them and post and I will check them too.

Read full topic
